page.description: The *ARRAY_APPEND() function re-dimensions an array and assigns a value to the new array element. It appends value to end of array and provide value if not assigning to it.

argument.name: array
argument.description: The array that receive the new value.

argument.name: value
argument.description: The new value to add to Array.

page.example: dim b[1] as C *array_append(b, "b1") *array_append(b, "b2") ? b = [1] = "b1" [2] = "b2" dim c[1] as N *array_append(c, 123) *array_append(c, 456) ? c = [1] = 123 [2] = 456

section.description: Instead of using *array_append(), the preferred syntax is to use [] with no array index, e.g.
section.example: dim a[0] as n a[] = 0 a[] = 0 a[] = 1
